H238.def: = to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H3948.def: = causative action by which humans and deities give verbal instruction to other humans, and by which the focus is on the communication of the message rather than the content of the message; ≈ often connoting persuasive or eloquent speech

H6201.def: literally: to neck; hence: = causative action by which humans kill animals by breaking their neck, which is normally done to unclean animals that, according to the law, cannot be sacrificed

H4306.def: = water coming down from the sky, which is indispensable for sustaining human life, but can be both refreshing and destructive

H565.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H5140.def: poetic term; = process by which liquids or odors move from one place to another

H2919.def: = condensed moisture resulting from contact of air and cooler land surfaces; ►an important source of water for vegetation; ≈ regarded as refreshing, life-enhancing; associated with fertility

H8164.def: = a fairly small, male domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and long hair, and usually found in one single {L:flock<SDBH:צֹאן>} with sheep; ► raised for its hair, often used for sacrifices; a clean animal, and therefore to be eaten

H1877.def: = a general term for plants, ► used as food by humans and animals; ≈ associated with frailty, but also with prosperity

H7241.def: = a brief and usually light fall of rain; ≈ regarded as a blessing

H6212.def: = any of various plants, herbs, grasses, seed-bearing vegetation that can be consumed by human and/or animal

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3051.def: = causative action by which humans transfer the possession of an object to someone else

H1433.def: = state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H6467.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H8549.def: = state in which an object is fully, unaffected and undiminished in its shape and form

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H530.def: = state in which an object does not move

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H3477.def: = state in which objects are without a bend or curve

H7843.def: = process by which objects are affected by violence, destruction, putrefaction, pollution, blemishes, and other factors that may have a destructive impact

H3971.def: = state in which humans or animals have a physical defect on their body

H6141.def: literally: to be crooked (of a person); hence: = state in which  humans lack integrity in everything they think or do

H6618.def: = pertaining to being intent on outwitting, tricking, or deceiving other people

H1580.def: = causative process by which a mother causes her baby to become accustomed to food other than its mother's milk

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5036.def: = foolish person who has no respect for God or his fellow human beings but thinks highly of himself

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H7069.def: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H2205.def: = state in which a human being is nearing the end of a long life

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H5945.def: = state of being in an elevated position

H5157.def: = action by which humans or deities take permanent possession of objects, humans, or property, either by inheritance or force

H6504.def: = process by which an object is split up into smaller units

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H5324.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals place themselves in a certain location in an upright position

H1367.def: = a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it

H4557.def: = an oral or written account of something

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2506.def: = one part of an object (or range of objects) that has been divided into several portions

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H8414.def: = location that is devoid of any life and without any structure or order

H3214.def: = process by which the wind makes a high-pitched sound

H3452.def: = area without water and therefore without vegetation and settlers; sometimes taken as the name of one specific region

H5437.def: = process by which a door is attached to a wall by means of a {L:hinge<SDBH:צִיר>}, or a contraption with a similar function, which allows it to pivot

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H5404.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = a grouping of large birds of prey with keen eyesight; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ associated with large size and great strength, ability to fly great distances at high speed; symbol of protection, metaphor for God, but also symbol for death in battle

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H7064.def: = structure, made by birds ◄ from twigs, straw, grass, or other materials, ► to lay their eggs and shelter their young; ≈ associated with security

H6566.def: = causative action by which humans spread out an object, such as a piece of cloth, a net, or a document either horizontally or vertically

H3671.def: = part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H84.def: = part of body; ◄ of bird; ► used for flying but also for protecting its young; ≈ associated with safety and security

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H910.def: = the state of being apart from significant others

H5148.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to move or be moved from one place to another

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H5236.def: = state in which something is associated with a nation or country that is different from one's own

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7392.def: = action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a {L:donkey<SDBH:חֲמֹור>} or a {L:horse<SDBH:סוּס>} or in a {L:chariot<SDBH:מֶרְכָּבָה>}

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H3243.def: = action by which newborn children drink milk from their mother's breasts

H1706.def: = sweet substance ◄ made either by bees, or from fruits such as dates, grapes or figs; ► much appreciated as food; ≈ associated with abundance and fertility

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H2496.def: = hard stone; ◄ consisting of nearly pure silica; ≈ symbol of a strong will-power

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H2529.def: = coagulated substance; ◄ formed by action of acids on milk; ► made into {L:cheese<SDBH:חָרִיץ>} or eaten as food; ≈ regarded as choice food and therefore often associated with prosperity; because of the smoothness of this substance it is sometimes associated with flattery and untrustworthiness as well

H1241.def: = large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth

H2461.def: = white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well-being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H2459.def: = fat parts ◄ of the body of animals and human beings; ► often the main ingredient of a sacrifice; ≈ regarded as the best part of the meat, but also associated with unresponsiveness and stubbornness

H3733.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = a young male sheep

H352.def: = male herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat-tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns; ≈ associated with strength and leadership

H1316.def: = region; ◄ north-east of the River {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}, ► at one time ruled by king {L:Og<SDBH:עֹוג>}, later assigned to half of the tribe of {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}

H6260.def: = dominant male goat in a {L:צֹאן<SDBH:צֹאן>}; ≈ associated with authority

H3629.def: = either of a pair of relatively small organs in the abdominal cavity of humans and animals; ≈ regarded as a delicacy and usually burned along with the fat of an animal sacrifice on the altar; considered the seat of emotions and one's devotion to God; in its literal sense only used for animals

H2406.def: = cereal plant bearing dense four-sided spike of grain; ◄ Triticum; ► important source of flour for bread; ≈ its color used to be regarded as the ideal color for the skin

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H2561.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid in the middle of the fermentation stage; ◄ made out of pressed grapes; ► used as beverage; ≈ associated with well-being

34.gl: (to be blessed with an abundance of the) finest grains of wheat

H3484.def: = another name for {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, used in poetry

H8080.def: literally: to be fat; hence: = state in which humans or animals look healthy and strong ◄ as a result of an abundance of food; ≈ it is important to note that fatness is usually regarded as a good quality in the OT, even though the causes and consequences are not necessarily considered positive; sometimes, however, fatness is associated with dullness and unresponsiveness

H1163.def: = action by which a human or animal strikes forcibly with the foot; ≈ associated with disobedience and rebellion

H5666.def: = state in which objects are relatively thick; ≈ often associated with health and prosperity

H3780.def: = state in which animals are relatively fat; ≈ often associated with health and prosperity

H5203.def: = process by which ropes that used to be tightly strung begin to hang loose

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H5034.def: = process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H3444.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

H7065.def: = process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to

H3707.def: = state/process by which humans or deities experience displeasure; ◄ caused by someone else's condition or behavior

H8441.def: = state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable

H2076.def: = causative action by which humans kill one or more animals, usually for food

H7700.def: = supernatural being, ≈ associated with pagan worship

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H2319.def: = state in which an object has been in existence for only a short time ◄ because of having recently been built or produced

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H2342.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H5006.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events, often caused by pride and contempt

H3708.def: = state in which human experience displeasure, which is said to reside in their {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>} ◄ and is caused by their own condition or by someone else

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H8419.def: literally: crookedness; hence: = state in which humans cannot be trusted to do the right thing or make the right choices in life

H529.def: = state in which humans are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their actions

H7065.def: = process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3707.def: = state/process by which humans or deities experience displeasure; ◄ caused by someone else's condition or behavior

H1892.def: = a slight movement of air; ≈ associated with something without substance, that quickly passes away

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H5036.def: = foolish person who has no respect for God or his fellow human beings but thinks highly of himself

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H6919.def: = process by which a fire starts burning; ≈ used as a metaphor for anger

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2981.def: = general term for plants that are sources of food; ≈ a sign of God's blessing

H3857.def: poetic term: = process by which fire gives off flames

H4144.def: = the bottom part of a construction, which bears everything built on top of it; sometimes used in a somewhat figurative sense to denote the foundations of heaven and earth

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H2671.def: = pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment

H4198.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = state/process by which humans experience a condition of extreme weakness of the body

H7458.def: = state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)

H3898.def: = action by which humans ingest food

H7565.def: = a sudden burst of brighly glowing light, whose source can be seen (like fire) or invisible (like lightning)

H4815.def: literally: bitter; hence: = state in which an event is of a very serious nature, and potentially fatal

H6986.def: = event that causes the end of a large number of people

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H929.def: often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to {L:humans<SDBH:אָדָם>}, {L:birds<SDBH:עֹוף>}, {L:reptiles<SDBH:רֶמֶשׂ>}, {L:insects<SDBH:שֶׁרֶץ>}, and {L:fish<SDBH:דָּג>}

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H2119.def: = action by which a limbless animal moves itself forward on its belly

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H2315.def: = area enclosed by walls or partitions, floor, and ceiling; ◄ part of building

H367.def: = state of strong fear because of an actual or perceived danger, such as aggression from the enemy, a dangerous animal, or death

H970.def: = a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H1330.def: = young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man

H3243.def: = action by which newborn children drink milk from their mother's breasts

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6284.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = causative action by which humans take the life of other humans in a violent way

H7673.def: = process by which an activity comes to an end

H2143.def: = process in which information that is stored in one's mind regarding someone or something is being reprocessed continually and/or repeatedly

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H3884.def: = marker indicating that if the event in focus would not have been true another event would not haven taken place

H1481.def: = state in which humans live in a place that is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

H3708.def: = state in which human experience displeasure, which is said to reside in their {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>} ◄ and is caused by their own condition or by someone else

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H5234.def: = process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6466.def: = action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H8394.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H2449.def: = state or process by which humans, deities, and animals possess or gain a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H7919.def: = state in which humans are able to accomplish whatever they attempt to do

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H505.def: = generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H7233.def: = state in which a countable entity is ten thousand in number; ≈ associated with excessively high numbers by which the exact number is relatively unimportant

H5127.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H4376.def: = causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5462.def: = causative action by which humans or deities close the entrance to a space with the help of a {L:door<SDBH:דֶּלֶת>}

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H6414.def: = a person whose responsibility it is to give a verdict on a case or person in a dispute and ensure that the verdict is implemented, which, ideally, results in vindication for the innocent and punishment for the guilty; this can only be done by someone in authority, such as a judge or ruler or even God himself

H1612.def: = a creeping plant, which grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils

H5467.def: = town; ◄ located near {L:Dead Sea<SDBH:יָם־הַמֶּלַח>}; ► town where {L:Lot<SDBH:לֹוט>} settled, when he separated himself from {L:Abram<SDBH:אַבְרָם>}; destroyed with {L:Gomorrah<SDBH:עֲמֹרָה>}

H7709.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, ► sometimes used for farming or pasturing animals

H7219.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H811.def: = group of flowers or fruits positioned on one stem

H4846.def: literally: bitter (organ); hence: = gall bladder, ≈ known for its bitter contents

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H8577.def: = mythical sea monster, such as {L:behemoth<SDBH:בְּהֵמֹות>} and {L:leviathan<SDBH:לִוְיָתָן>}

H393.def: = pertaining to being without mercy towards humans and animals

H7219.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H6620.def: = snake with the ability to spread the ribs in the neck area, so as to form a broad, flat profile called the hood, which makes it look thicker than it really is; reaches two meters in length and 50 millimeters in diameter; it is dark brown with a yellowish underside; very poisonous; feeds on mice, gerbils, birds, bird eggs, lizards, frogs, and other snakes; ≈ associated with great danger

glosses: to store up > to keep (in mind)
H3647.def: = process by which something is collected and deposited, ► for further use

H2856.def: = to put a seal on a written document; ► in order to confirm that the document is authentic and to keep unauthorized readers from having access to it; ≈ associated with both authenticity and secrecy

H214.def: = valuable goods in one's possession; ≈ falsely considered a source of well-being

8.gl: to store up > to keep (in mind)

H5359.def: = action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H4131.def: = state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H343.def: = extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death

H6264.def: = state in which someone is prepared for an event

H2363.def: = process by which an event happens quickly

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H6113.def: = action by which someone slows down or stops moving forward entirely

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H335.def: = referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H2620.def: = action by which humans and animals who find themselves in difficult circumstances go to a certain location, ► in order to find protection or safety

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H2459.def: = fat parts ◄ of the body of animals and human beings; ► often the main ingredient of a sacrifice; ≈ regarded as the best part of the meat, but also associated with unresponsiveness and stubbornness

H2077.def: = the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and the other part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H5257.def: = action by which humans pour out a liquid, such as {L:wine<SDBH:יַיִן>}, {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, or even {L:blood<SDBH:דָּם>} before a deity ► as a sacrifice

H5826.def: = process by which humans receive assistance or supported from other humans or deities

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H4272.def: = action by which humans strike other humans or animals with a hammer, club or similar object, resulting in breaking the underlying bones

H7495.def: = causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans or animals to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself; ≈ often used figuratively to denote the state of a country or nation suffering from the consequences of their unfaithfulness

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H1300.def: = process by which bright flashes of light are seen between clouds and the ground or within clouds, often accompanied by thunder; ≈ regarded as fire from heaven and arrows or spears from God

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H5359.def: = action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

12.gl: to hold on (to a type of behavior)

H2671.def: = pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H2491.def: = state in which humans or animal are fatally wounded with a sharp object

H7633.def: = a group of people that have been forcibly carried off to prison, into slavery, or exile

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H5359.def: = action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H4872.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}, younger brother of {L:Miriam<SDBH:מִרְיָם>} and {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► leader of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} during exodus

H1954.def: = man, also known as {L:Joshua<SDBH:יְהֹושֻׁעַ>} and {L:Jeshua<SDBH:יֵשׁוּעַ>}; ◄ son of {L:Nun<SDBH:נוּן>}; tribe of {L:Ephraim<SDBH:אֶפְרַיִם>}; ► one of the twelve men sent by {L:Moses<SDBH:מֹשֶׁה>} to spy out the land; his original name was Hoshea, which was later changed by Moses to Joshua; he was Moses' assistant, who later became his successor and brought {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} into {L:Canaan<SDBH:כְּנַעַן>}

H5126.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Elishama<SDBH:אֱלִישָׁמָע>}; tribe of {L:Ephraim<SDBH:אֶפְרַיִם>}; ► father of {L:Hoshea<SDBH:הֹושֵׁעַ>}, who is better known as {L:Joshua<SDBH:יְהֹושׁוּעַ>}

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H4872.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}, younger brother of {L:Miriam<SDBH:מִרְיָם>} and {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► leader of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} during exodus

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter
